GeneralInformation.School Vision: Leaders of Character, Learners for Life
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture people of character, healthy patriotic citizens and creative independent thinkers equipped with 21st century skills
School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school believes in the holistic development of the child. Guided by our school vision "Leaders of Character, Learners for Life", the school has five desired student outcomes for every Townsvillite growing students to be: a gracious pupil; a self-directed learner; a creative thinker; a responsible citizen; and a resilient leader.

Our school values, the iCARe3 (Integrity our Foundation; Compassion our Key; Ardent for Singapore, our Home; Respect, Responsibility & Resilience, our Strengths) are not only taught explicitly by teachers and incorporated in to our school programmes.

The school has a Culture of Care, Collaboration & Excellence. Pupils put into practice the Care for Self, Care for Others, Care for School and Care for the Community. They are also exposed to different learning opportunities to develop and horn their skills to effectively collaborate with others to achieve excellence.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: Government School / Co-ed School / Single Session

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school has identified the Visual Arts, our LLP, as a platform to deliver a well-rounded education.  Through the visual arts, students acquire not only art-making knowledge and skills but also develop 21st century competencies such as critical and inventive thinking skills. Our LLP also caters to the social-emotional growth of students by offering an avenue for life-long enjoyment and appreciation of artistic works and performances.  The processes of ideation, conceptualization, development, refinement and appreciation of art, coupled with the richness of different art genres, also enables pupils to strengthen their understanding of national identity and foster an appreciation of their cultural heritage.
